SEARCH
Package fang2.media

Class SampledSound

java.lang.Object
fang2.media.SequentialSound
fang2.media.SampledSound
All Implemented Interfaces:
RawMediaCache.MediaLoadListener
public class SampledSound extends SequentialSound implements RawMediaCache.MediaLoadListener
Plays mp3 and wav files. This class plays sounds as soon as they are available, skipping the beginning part of the sound if it still loading when it is requested to start playing.

  • Constructor Details

    • SampledSound

      public SampledSound(URL soundFile)
      loads a sound. The sound is loaded serially in a separate thread in the order in which the SinglePlayable is constructed.
      Parameters:
      soundFile - the location of the sound

  • Method Details

    • getClipPosition

      public double getClipPosition()
      gets how long the sound has been playing. When looping, this is just the time since the most recent repeat.
      Specified by:
      getClipPosition in class SequentialSound
      Returns:
      the time since the start in seconds

    • start

      public void start()
      starts playing the sound. This adds a brief buffer (twice interval) to insure smooth playback.
      Overrides:
      start in class SequentialSound

    • setPan

      public void setPan(double pan)
      sets the panning of the audio. Panning is like balance except that it does not eliminate the side; panning moves the sound more to one side or the other. The value for panning is much like the values for the horizontal positioning in the FANG Engine. 0 is all the way to the left and 1 is all the way to the right. It is also possible to pan somewhere in between by using fractional values.
      Overrides:
      setPan in class SequentialSound
      Parameters:
      pan - the side on which to play. 0 is all the way to the left and 1 is all the way to the right. It is also possible to pan somewhere in between by using fractional values.

    • setVolume

      public void setVolume(double volume)
      Description copied from class: SequentialSound
      sets the volume of this clip. This method actually affects the gain in a linear way. Setting the value to 1 means that the sound's volume is unchanged. Setting the value to 2 makes it twice as loud whereas setting it to 0.5 makes the sound 1/2 as loud. A default method is provided, but classes that extend SequentialSound may optionally make this method affect the actual sound.
      Overrides:
      setVolume in class SequentialSound
      Parameters:
      volume - the multiplier to affect the volume

    • play

      public void play()
      Description copied from class: SequentialSound
      starts the sound playing
      Specified by:
      play in class SequentialSound

    • play

      public void play(double pan)
      Description copied from class: SequentialSound
      plays the sound, controlling the panning left or right
      Overrides:
      play in class SequentialSound
      Parameters:
      pan - the side on which to play where 0.0 is entirely on the left and 1.0 is entirely on the right, and 0.5 is evenly balanced. Any value between 0.0 and 1.0 is valid.

    • isFinishedPlaying

      public boolean isFinishedPlaying()
      Description copied from class: SequentialSound
      determines if this sound is done playing. The sound is done playing when it either has not started or when it has reached the end of its playing duration.
      Overrides:
      isFinishedPlaying in class SequentialSound
      Returns:
      true if sound is done; false otherwise

    • getLoopsLeft

      public int getLoopsLeft()
      Description copied from class: SequentialSound
      gets how many times the sound will play through until it stops. The default is 0 meaning that once the current clip ends, the sound terminates.
      Specified by:
      getLoopsLeft in class SequentialSound
      Returns:
      the number of entire clip durations left to play (zero is the default)

    • isLoaded

      public boolean isLoaded()
      Description copied from class: SequentialSound
      determines if the sound clip has been entirely loaded. Since loading is a time consuming operation, a sound may not be ready to play immediately after it is constructed.
      Specified by:
      isLoaded in class SequentialSound
      Returns:
      true if the sound has been loaded completely, false otherwise
